Description: Indicates the instantaneous length of the queue in which threads are waiting for the processor cycle. This length does not include the threads that are currently being executed.
Interpretation: A value consistently greater than 2 indicates that many processes could be simultaneously contending for the processor.

Description: Indicates the number of processes currently blocked for I/O, paging, etc.
Interpretation: A high value could indicate an I/O problem on the host (e.g., a slow disk).

Description: This measurement denotes the committed amount of virtual memory. This corresponds to the space reserved for virtual memory on disk paging file(s).
Interpretation: An unusually high value for the swap usage can indicate a memory bottleneck. Check the memory utilization of individual processes to figure out the process(es) that has (have) maximum memory consumption and look to tune their memory usages and allocations accordingly.

Description: Indicates the free memory available currently.
Interpretation: A very low value of free memory is also an indication of high memory utilization on a host. The detailed diagnosis of this measure lists the top 10 processes responsible for maximum memory consumption on the host.
A high value is indicative of memory thrashing. Excessive thrashing can be detrimental to application performance.
